execution_plan.description: Get, from the orders database, the number of distinct orders each product appears in (product_id -> order_count). This returns one row per product that appears in Order_Items.
execution_plan.query: SELECT product_id, COUNT(DISTINCT order_id) AS order_count FROM Order_Items GROUP BY product_id;

execution_plan.description: Retrieve product details from the products database for products that appear in orders (products whose ids are present in step 1). The application will use the order_count from step 1 to filter those with fewer than two orders.
execution_plan.query: SELECT product_id, product_name, product_price, product_color FROM Products WHERE product_id IN ($step1.product_id);

execution_plan.description: Retrieve product details from the products database for products that do NOT appear in any Order_Items (these products have zero orders).
execution_plan.query: SELECT product_id, product_name, product_price, product_color FROM Products WHERE product_id NOT IN ($step1.product_id);
